title.rendered: Free map transforms the survival hit into a cult shooter

content.rendered:
You want to kill demons in Minecraft? Could you! With a free adventure map. (Image source: YouTube/Sibogy)

The Minecraft sandbox allows for all sorts of practical jokes. With the help of adventure maps, you can even ship whole games into the survival game. A fan did that and presents his free map in a YouTube trailer. You can look forward to real shooter fun of a cult game.

Minecraft becomes Doom: Adventure map breaks the genres

Minecraft has been an integral part of the gaming industry for over 10 years – and despite its advanced age, the community can still cause gigantic storms of enthusiasm with some creations. For example, one player managed to build a circle in the block game – and without mods!

YouTuber and Minecraft fan Sibogy, on the other hand, has set himself the task of turning the relaxed block game into a real shooter from hell. His new adventure map DOOMED: Demons of the Nether, which he finally finished after two years of work, lets you shoot down demons in the underworld. You can see what it looks like in the game in the trailer:

Minecraft fans are excited

The video for the adventure map causes a storm of enthusiasm among Minecraft fans on Reddit. More than 35,000 likes and 580 comments The post has already accumulated – most of them congratulate Sibogy on this phenomenal achievement and praise one after the other (source: Reddit). Especially the fact that the user offers its adventure map for all players to download free of chargeis well received.

Download Minecraft Adventure Map now for free

But the thing has a small catch for some players: The adventure map is only available for the Java edition of Minecraft. Owners of the console version or Bedrock Edition on the PC get nothing.

Minecraft: 9 secrets that you definitely didn’t know Start photo gallery(11 photos)

The adventure map seems to have hit the nail on the head in terms of atmosphere and game speed. For all Java Edition players, DOOMED: Demons of the Nether is definitely worth a look.
